RelationshipElement.name: Above - Below
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a above below for contexts.

RelationshipElement.name: Same As
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a same as for contexts.

RelationshipElement.name: Bonded To
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a bonded to for contexts

RelationshipElement.name: Stratigraphically - Arbitrarily separated from
RelationshipElement.description: When two or more context codes have been assigned to what is ultimately determined to be the same context

RelationshipElement.name: Stratigraphically - Broadly contemporary with
RelationshipElement.description: Contexts suspected to be contemporary but no direct physical relationship or evidence (i.e. adjacent buildings)

RelationshipElement.name: Stratigraphically - EarlierLater
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a Stratigraphically Immediately Earlier-Later for contexts.

RelationshipElement.name: ContextMatrix
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a 1:N between contexts and matrices

RelationshipElement.name: ContextContextGroup
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a N:N between contexts and context groups

RelationshipElement.name: ContextArtefactGroup
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a 1:N between context and its artefact groups

RelationshipElement.name: ContextSample
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a 1:N between context and its samples

RelationshipElement.name: ContextSpecialFind
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a 1:N between context and its special finds

RelationshipElement.name: ContextPhotographLog
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a 1:N between context and its photograph logs

RelationshipElement.name: ContextGroupPhotographLog
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a 1:N between context group and its photograph logs

ArchaeologicalElement.name: Context
ArchaeologicalElement.description: The physical result of any single action whether it leaves a positive or negative record within the stratigraphic sequence. (MoLAS 1994)

property.name: Site Code
property.description: Short code to signify the excavation site and often the year of excavation. Assigned automatically by the module.

property.name: Context ID
property.description:
Every archaeological context (negative element (cut), deposit, structure, skeleton) is given a unique 3 or 4 letter context code. Each trench is designated with a separate letter which starts the code, so it is immediately obvious to which trench a context belongs. For example context HAA belongs to Trench H, context MQP to Trench M etc.
The contexts are labelled consecutively in alphabetical order using the letters following the trench letter. For Trench H the first context would be HAA, the second HAB, the third HAB and so on. In addition sets of letters can denote parts of trenches, buildings etc. E.g. HFs might denote contexts from a specific building.
Burial context codes begin with the letter Z, followed by the trench letter. Hence burial ZHA is the first burial context from trench H.
Check with the trench supervisor who will assign the context code. The module will not allow a context code to be used twice on a single device.

property.name: Context Name
property.description: Brief name for the Context eg House A - west wall

property.name: Excavators
property.description: Initials of the excavators that have worked on the context.

property.name: Plans
property.description: Reference numbers to plans or drawings of this Context.

property.name: AreaCode
property.description: The excavation trench, designated by a letter code and assigned automatically by the module.

property.name: Grid X
property.description: The X coordinate on the SW corner of the context.

property.name: Grid Y
property.description: The Y coordinate on the SW corner of the context.

property.name: Context Type
property.description: Describe the context type by selecting an icon as defined below. When you have selected a context type you can proceed to open the "Fill in context type details" page. Note this page will not open unless you have selected a context type.

lookup.term: {Cut} Any Context which represents the removal of earlier deposit and thus forms a negative interface (cut) with another context, such as a cut for a pit, burial, ditch, wall foundation or robber trench.
{Deposit} Any Context with deposited sediment and soil, such as floor layers, pit and grave fills, hearth fills and natural sediments.
{Structure} Any Context consisting of deliberately constructed structural element, independent of a Negative Element (i.e. cut, such as a wall or a hearth).

property.name: Date Opened
property.description: Date on which the Context was first excavated. This will automatically be set to the date on which the context is recorded but can be edited using the keyboard.

property.name: Date Closed
property.description: The date excavation of the Context ended and it was closed. Press the Add Date Closed button to insert todayâ€™s date.

property.name: Location Note
property.description: For Approx location in area provide information on rough location eg centre of Area A or NW corner area A but also in relation to other archaeological contexts or features e.g. between walls x and y.

property.name: Excavation Method
property.description: Method and conditions of archaeological excavation.

property.name: Highest Level
property.description: The highest elevation or starting level recorded for that context. This may be relative to the site grid or real world co-ordinates depending on the method of measurement.

property.name: Lowest Level
property.description: The lowest elevation recorded for that context. This may be relative to the site grid or real world co-ordinates depending on the method of measurement.

property.name: Length
property.description: Longest dimension in metres.

property.name: Width
property.description: Width or diameter in metres.

property.name: Depth
property.description: Depth or Height in metres.

property.name: Section Numbers
property.description: Reference numbers to section drawings of this Context

property.name: Soil Compaction Type
property.description: Describe the compaction of the sediments in the Context.

lookup.term: {2.Friable} Deposit disintegrates into small particles under pressure.
{3.Crumbly} Deposit disintegrates into lumps under pressure.

property.name: Soil Compaction Description
property.description: Description of the compaction of soil including changes throughout the deposit. Eg "Varies from loose to compact."

property.name: Soil Texture Helper
property.description: This helper is based on the standard flow chart for determining soil texture. Start by taking 25g of soil and placing it in your palm. Select each option and follow the prompts for TASKS (like roll ribbon) until you get a result, eg silty loam. Then click the Update button to have that value pasted onto your Context record.

property.name: Soil Texture
property.description: The type of sediment, eg clay, silt, sand and loam. Use the {Texture_Helper} or a Soil Sediment diagram for assisance.

lookup.term: {0No_Observation} No Observation. Use the Texture helper to prefil this.
{1.Sand} A sand has a loose gritty feel and does not stick together. Individual sand grains can be seen or felt. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)
{1.Loamy_Sand} In a loamy sand particles barely stick together and a moulded piece of soil just holds its shape. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)
{2.Silty_Clay_Loam} A silty clay loam is like a clay loam but silty as well and smooth to the touch. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

{2.Clay_Loam} More easily moulded into a shape than a loam a clay loam rolls out to a thin ribbon between the palms while a loam will break-up. When dry a clay loam will form a lump but is not as tough to break as a clay.(VDEPI 2009: AG0058)
{2.Sandy_Clay_Loam} A sandy clay loam is like a clay loam but sand grains can be felt (and heard - see Sandy Loam) (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

{2.Silt_Loam} A silty loam is like a loam but has a smooth silky feel when a moist sample is pushed between the index finger and thumb. On drying a sample can form a hard lump but this may be broken by hand. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

{2.Loam} A loam breaks into crumbs but will tend to stick together. Sand grains cannot be felt in a moist sample which when squeezed will retain its shape when handled freely. Loams are usually soft to the feel. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

{2.Sandy_Loam} A sandy loam sticks together more than a loamy sand but can be easily broken. Individual sand grains can be felt and heard if a wet sample is rubbed between the index finger and thumb and held close to the ear. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)
{3.Silty_Clay} A silty clay is like a clay but smoother. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

{3.Clay} Clays are tough and can be moulded into shapes when moist. Clays form a long flexible ribbon when rubbed between the palms and the ribbon can often be bent into a U shape without breaking. Clays dry into very hard clods. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)
{3.Sandy_Clay} A sandy clay is like a clay but sand grains can be felt (and heard - see Sandy Loam). (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

property.name: Soil Particle Sorting
property.description: Assessment of the frequency with which particles of the same size occur.

lookup.term: {3.Moderately_sorted} Particles are mostly the same size and evenly distributed but there are some larger particles.
{2.Poorly_sorted} Particles are different sizes and unevenly distributed.
{1.Very_poorly_sorted} Particles are very different sizes and very unevenly distributed.
{4.Well_sorted} Particles are roughly the same size and evenly distributed.

property.name: Soil Colour
property.description: Broad colour description of the soil, eg mid greyish brown.

property.name: Sterile
property.description: Whether or not the deposit is sterile, ie contains no artefacts

property.name: Deposit Inclusions
property.description: Brief description of inclusions (eg stone flecks artefacts).

property.name: Volume
property.description: Estimate the volume of the context in litres. All soil will be collected in buckets of a known volume. A tally should be kept of buckets produced from a context and the total volume calculated using that tally.

property.name: Contamination
property.description: The extent to which the context has been contaminated.

lookup.term: {5.Contaminated} Contaminated by later material eg by unidentified cut at time of initial excavation by large scale animal or root activity which were not isolated by excavation by excavation processes some annoying person mixed the material or stuff fell into deposit from the section.

{4.High_Likely_Contaminated} It is very likely that significant amounts of earlier artifact and ecofact material has become incorporated in the deposit. For example; is this context a mud brick wall or other structure or building or structural debris or a deposit which has seen the redeposition of material excavated from cuts. These are all situations in which earlier material is likely to have been dug up and re-used (in the mud brick) or re-deposited (when digging out pits).
{2.Low_Likely_Contaminated} You think there is little chance that very much earlier material has made its way into this deposit.

{1.Primary_Deposit} You are very sure that the deposit and all finds therein directly relate to activity within a specific period of time and there is thus minimal amounts of derived material and no contamination.

property.name: Horizon Boundary
property.description: Describe the boundary between this and the next context.

lookup.term: {Doubtful}You are uncertain of whether you accurately excavated a boundary between deposits.
{Ambiguous}You are uncertain as to whether there was a boundary between contexts.
{Merging}There is a distinction between the excavated context and earlier context(s) but the excavated contexts and the earlier contexts grade into each other.
{Clear}The boundary with the earlier context(s) was very clearly defined during excavation.
{Arbitrary_Spit}There is no meaningful boundary with an earlier context. The boundary has been artificially created by the excavation process.

property.name: Shape of Cut
property.description: Describe the shape of the negative element/cut viewed from above.

lookup.term: {Linear} Straight sided but not square or rectangular.
{Rectangular} Two sides longer than the other.

property.name: Shape of Cut - Note
property.description: Additional notes about the shape of the cut.

property.name: Shape of Corners
property.description: Describe the shape of any visible corners of the negative element/cut.

property.name: Break of Slope - Top
property.description: The degree with which the top surface of the edge of the cut breaks into the sides.

lookup.term: {Not_perceptible} Well-rounded; there is no perceptible difference between the sides of the cut and the surface into which it protrudes.

property.name: Sides of Cut
property.description: Describe the shape of the cut as seen in cross section.

property.name: Shape of Base
property.description: The shape of the base of the cut in profile.

property.name: Cut Function
property.description: Comment in more specific detail on your understanding of the reasons for the shape and nature of the cut.

property.name: Orientation
property.description: Orientation of linear cuts eg N-S.

property.name: Inclination of axis
property.description: Inclination of the axis of post- and stakeholes.

property.name: Structure Your Interpretation
property.description: Your interpretation of the likely function of the structure.

lookup.term: {zOther} Function not elsewhere described. Provide details in Annotation field.

property.name: Cut Your Interpretation
property.description: Your interpretation of the likely function of the Context using standardised definitions.

lookup.term: {zOther} Function not elsewhere described. Provide details in Annotation field.

property.name: Deposit Your Interpretation
property.description: Your interpretation of the likely function of the context.

lookup.term: {Indeterminate} You are unable to make an assessment of possible function.
{Packing} Packing in a post hole for post material fulfilling a constructional purpose other than deliberate levelling deposits.
{Levelling_Fill} Material laid down to level or raise an area for constructional purposes or other activities.
{Dump} Material probably dumped as a result of other activity e.g. material removed from cuts or other constructional or destructional activity.
{Midden} Distinct area of organic rubbish accumulation
{Burial} A fill or other deposit associated with a skeleton and forming part of a burial feature.
{Structural_Debris} Material derived from collapse of a wall, roof or other structure
{Partly_naturally_derived} A deposit partly or wholly accumulating through natural sedimentary processes, such as water or wind deposition.

{Wholly_naturally_derived} All of the deposit accumulating through the deposition of natural sediments through geomorphological processes eg wind borne sediments water-laid natural sediments material flaking from cave and rock shelter walls.
{Erosional_products} Material deriving from the erosion of earlier archaeological sediments.
{Artifact_cluster} A distinct concentration of artifacts or ecofacts. Make sure you record its xyz coordinates centre and edges.
{Ash_or_Charcoal} A deposit consisting largely of carbonized/charred plant material and/or ash

{Arbitrary} This applies to artificial contexts excavated for excavational convenience eg section cleaning material whose precise provenience is unclear. Does not include arbitrary spits or spatial units deliberately excavated for finer control of horizontal and vert

{Distinct_floor_contact} To be used for material that directly reflects the use of a surface or floor - artifact material on the surface perhaps thin deposits of occupation material. These contexts will be gridded into spatial units for closer control of artifact distributions.
{Animal_or_Plant} Deposit derived from plant or animal activity
{zOther} Function not elsewhere described. Provide details in Annotation field.

property.name: Your Discussion
property.description: Enter an interpretation of the function of the Context and its place in the stratigraphical sequence.

property.name: Your description
property.description: Enter a verbal description of the Context, including its form, contexts, relationship to other Contexts and any other relevant information. This is the main place to record all other descriptive information that may be treated briefly or not covered elsewhere, including signs of disturbance by burrowing animals etc.

property.name: Sketch
property.description: Upload the file of a sketch of the context/artefact etc drawn on another application using the button below

property.name: Photo
property.description: Use this button to take a photo of the context/artefact etc using the camera on the tablet

property.name: Audio
property.description: Use this button to record an audio file of your observations concerning this context/artefact

property.name: Video
property.description: Use this button to record a video using the tablet of this context/artefact etc

property.name: Structural Components
property.description: Describe what the structure is made from.

lookup.term: {Stone} Worked or unworked stone used in masonry walls.
{Other} Material not otherwise described. Add description and notes in Annotation field.

property.name: Bonding
property.description: Additional details of the bonding/packing material.

lookup.term: {Unmortared} No visible bonding material ie unmortared.

property.name: Bonding Details
property.description: What has been used to bind the major elements together? Is there mud mortar in a wall, or chinking stones?

property.name: Bond Type
property.description: The type of bonding course eg English bond

property.name: Distinguishing Marks
property.description: Describe and distinguishing marks on the bricks or stone, such as makers marks, score marks etc.

property.name: Structure Description
property.description: Describe the structure.

property.name: Number Courses
property.description: The number of vertical layers of structural elements such as bricks.

property.name: Set In Cut
property.description: Give the cut context code if relevant. If not set in cut then put NA.

property.name: Structure Shape
property.description: The shape of the structural element, in plan.

lookup.term: {Linear} Straight sided but not square or rectangular.
{Rectangular} Two sides longer than the other.

property.name: Mudbrick Shape
property.description: The shape of mudbrick(s).

lookup.term: {Rectangular} With straight edges, upper and lower surfaces.

property.name: Component Finish
property.description: How have the material types been prepared (i.e dressed stones polished/smoothed/painted plaster surface).

property.name: Composition Type
property.description: Describe the structure of the Context sediment. The components making up the structure are added below as aggregates.

lookup.term: {Heterogeneous} Deposit with different mixed components which need to be described.
{Laminated} Laminated Deposit consists of lots of fine lenses of the same material. Compact laminated Deposit consists of a number of fine lenses of different materials.
{Compact_Laminated} Deposit consists of a number of fine lenses of different materials

property.name: Deposit Bedding
property.description: Describes the base of the deposit

lookup.term: {Uneven} Mix of horizontal, oblique and undulating - make sure you describe this

property.name: Space
property.description: Enter the space number, which may define an internal or external area in which the skeleton is located.

property.name: Building
property.description: A building can comprise one or more internal spaces so enter the building number in which the skeleton is located.

property.name: Mid_X
property.description: An appropriate mid-point on the skeleton under excavation should be recorded on the X / Y co-ordinates. This will locate the skeleton on the site grid system.

property.name: Mid_Y
property.description: An appropriate mid-point on the skeleton under excavation should be recorded on the X / Y co-ordinates. This will locate the skeleton on the site grid system.

property.name: Skeleton Dimensions
property.description: Record the approximate extent of the skeletal remains (in meters or millimetres only) and the axis of measurement. Detailed dimensions can be taken from the plan.

property.name: Skeleton Body
property.description: Describe the attitude of the body, whether it is extended, crouched, flexed, supine (front up), prone (face down) and the orientation.

property.name: Skeleton Head
property.description: Which way up the head faces and/or points

property.name: Skeleton Right Arm
property.description: Record whether right arm is straight or flexed, is along the side of the body, over the chest or on the pelvis, and the position of the hand.

property.name: Skeleton Left Arm
property.description: Record whether left arm is straight or flexed, is along the side of the body, over the chest or on the pelvis, and the position of the hand.

property.name: Skeleton Right Leg
property.description: Record whether the leg is straight or bent, crossed left over right or right over left and the position of the foot

property.name: Skeleton Left Leg
property.description: Record whether the leg is straight or bent, crossed left over right or right over left and the position of the foot

property.name: Skeleton Condition
property.description: Describe the general condition of the skeleton and any comments on articulation. Any degeneration of bone in situ is important to record as well as accidental damage during excavation and lifting. Record disturbances through later activity or animal/root activity as well as damage due to stone pressure on the bones. It is important to note whether the patellae, hyoid, phalanges, basi-occipital etc are present or not, and their location, as this may give an indication of the state of the body at the time of interment.

property.name: Skeleton Surface Modifications
property.description: Note any cut marks, evidence of stains and/or colour during the course of the excavation, burning, chewing marks, root activity etc.

property.name: Skeleton Environment
property.description: The physical environment at the time of excavation may affect the state of the bone therefore it is important to note the weather and conditions you are working in.

property.name: Skeleton Days Exposed
property.description: It is important to excavate skeletal remains as quickly as possible as the state of the bone will change during exposure. Any conditional change should also be noted. Excavate as quickly as possible because the bones will degrade rapidly.

property.name: Target A X
property.description: The X coordinate of Target A. Targets are white-painted, large-headed nails used to rectify photographs.

property.name: Target A Y
property.description: The Y coordinate of Target A. Targets are white-painted, large-headed nails used to rectify photographs.

property.name: Target B X
property.description: The X coordinate of Target B. Targets are white-painted, large-headed nails used to rectify photographs.

property.name: Target B Y
property.description: The Y coordinate of Target B. Targets are white-painted, large-headed nails used to rectify photographs.

property.name: Target C X
property.description: The X coordinate of Target C. Targets are white-painted, large-headed nails used to rectify photographs.

property.name: Target C Y
property.description: The Y coordinate of Target C. Targets are white-painted, large-headed nails used to rectify photographs.

property.name: Target D X
property.description: The X coordinate of Target D. Targets are white-painted, large-headed nails used to rectify photographs.

property.name: Target D Y
property.description: The Y coordinate of Target D. Targets are white-painted, large-headed nails used to rectify photographs.

property.name: SearchHelp
property.description: This allows you to find any contexts that contain your search term or string in any field in a context record. Type in your term/string and press the "Search" button. Press "My Contexts" to return to the full list of contexts for this trench.

property.name: Site Code
property.description: Short code to signify the excavation site and often the year of excavation. Assigned automatically by the module.

property.name: Area Code
property.description: The excavation trench, designated by a letter code and assigned automatically by the module.

property.name: Context Group ID
property.description: Feature number taken from the appropriate running list.

property.name: Title
property.description: Enter the Feature name e.g. Hearth in Building 2.

property.name: Location Note CG
property.description: Record where the feature is within a space / building/area if relevant and in particular its relationship to other features or key contexts.

property.name: Building
property.description: Identify the building in which the feature is located.

property.name: Space
property.description: Identify the space in which the feature is located if relevant.

property.name: CG Context Type
property.description: Enter the type of feature you are describing.

lookup.term: {Cut} Any Context which forms a negative interface (cut) with another context, such as a cut for a pit, burial, ditch, wall foundation or robber trench.
{Deposit} Any Context with deposited sediment and soil, such as floor layers, pit and grave fills, hearth fills and natural sediments.
{Structure} Any Context consisting of deliberately constructed structures, independent of a Negative Element (i.e. cut, such as walls and hearths).
{Wall} A structured vertical barrier made from durable materials defining a space.
{Floor} A prepared surface, internal or external, including those made from plaster, earth etc.
{Well} A deep pit excavated to reach the water table.
{Pit} A large cut filled with sediment or other materials.
{Room} A discrete space within a house or other building.
{Burial} The cut, fill plus any associated structures relating to the deposition of human remains, including those remains, such as a skeleton.
{Building} A building is defined when several walls surround a discrete space
{Surface} A compacted horizontal layer, internal or external, on which activities took place.
{Space} A space is an area bounded by a structure of some kind, either external or internal, and can be for example a courtyard, room, ante-room etc.
{Posthole}A small pit cut to hold an upright post.
{Stakehole}Cuts smaller than postholes, typically c. 1-5 cm diameter.
{Hearth}A prepared structure in which a fire is set.
{Stakehole_row} A row of cuts smaller than postholes, typically c. 1-5 cm diameter.
{zOther}Function not elsewhere described. Provide details in Annotation field.

property.name: CG Your Interpretation
property.description: Describe your understanding of the feature function, phasing etc.

property.name: CG Your description
property.description: Describe the feature, any details of dimensions, disturbance, orientation etc.

property.name: Your Discussion
property.description: Add here any elaborations on the interpretation and description.

property.name: Length
property.description: Longest dimension in metres.

property.name: Width
property.description: Width or diameter in metres.

property.name: Depth
property.description: Depth or Height in metres.

property.name: Mid X
property.description: An appropriate mid-point on the feature should be recorded on the X/Y coordinates. This will locate the feature on the site grid system.

property.name: Mid Y
property.description: An appropriate mid-point on the feature should be recorded on the X/Y coordinates. This will locate the feature on the site grid system.

property.name: CG Phase Notes
property.description: The site or building phase in which this Feature was constructed or deposited.

property.name: CG Plans
property.description: Reference numbers to plans or drawings of this Context.

property.name: CG Section Numbers
property.description: Reference numbers to section drawings of this Context

property.name: Sketch
property.description: Upload the file of a sketch of the context/artefact etc drawn on another application using the button below

property.name: Photo
property.description: Use this button to take a photo of the context/artefact etc using the camera on the tablet

property.name: Audio
property.description: Use this button to record an audio file of your observations concerning this context/artefact

property.name: Video
property.description: Use this button to record a video using the tablet of this context/artefact etc

property.name: Percentage
property.description: Enter the approximate % volume of this material in the Context.

property.name: Component
property.description: Describe the components which make up 10% or more of the deposit.

lookup.term: {5.Midden} Organic debris e.g. bones carbonised material phytoliths etc
{Mudbrick} Fragments of mudbrick or whole mudbricks not part of a coherent structural element.
{Ash} White/grey fine material which may contain charcoal and other burnt plant material.
{Artefacts} Human manufactured materials including lithics, beads, ground stone etc.

property.name: Shape
property.description: Shape and roundness of stones and pebbles in the deposit.

lookup.term: {Dressed_Stone} Those that have been clearly shaped for use.
{Tabular} Stones with flattened upper and lower surfaces.
{Ground} Stones that have been deliberately shaped smooth by grinding.

ArchaeologicalElement.name: Artefact Group
ArchaeologicalElement.description: The total group or assemblage of objects recovered from a single Context. These are sometimes referred to as Bulk Finds.

property.name: Site Code
property.description: Short code to signify the excavation site and often the year of excavation. Assigned automatically by the module.

property.name: Context ID
property.description: Unique number or code for the Context from which this {Artefact_Group} was collected.

property.name: Artefact Group ID
property.description: Unique number or code for the {Artefact_Group}.

property.name: Artefact Class
property.description: Broad Artefact Class for each Artefact (eg Glass Ceramic Building Material).

property.name: Artefact X
property.description: The reading from the x-axis (horizontal) of an arbitrary site grid corresponding to the location of the {Artefact_Group} at the time of excavation.

property.name: Artefact Y
property.description: The reading from the y-axis (vertical) of an arbitrary site grid corresponding to the location of the {Artefact_Group} at the time of excavation.

property.name: Artefact Z
property.description: The elevation or depth of the {Artefact_Group} at the time of excavation.

property.name: Artefact Quantity
property.description: The number of artefacts in this {Artefact_Group}.

property.name: Artefact Weight
property.description: The total weight of all artefacts in this {Artefact_Group}.

property.name: Artefact Group Comment
property.description: General comment about this {Artefact_Group} from this Context eg 8 obsidian blades in cache below wall.

property.name: Sketch
property.description: Upload the file of a sketch of the context/artefact etc drawn on another application using the button below

property.name: Photo
property.description: Use this button to take a photo of the context/artefact etc using the camera on the tablet

property.name: Audio
property.description: Use this button to record an audio file of your observations concerning this context/artefact

property.name: Video
property.description: Use this button to record a video using the tablet of this context/artefact etc

ArchaeologicalElement.name: Sample
ArchaeologicalElement.description: Deposit samples or samples of building elements recovered from this Context for the purpose of further analysis or ongoing reference.

property.name: Site Code
property.description: Short code to signify the excavation site and often the year of excavation. Assigned automatically by the module.

property.name: Context ID
property.description: Unique number or code for the Context from which this Sample was collected.

property.name: Sample ID
property.description: The unique code or reference for the Sample.

property.name: Sample Type
property.description: Record the sample type.

lookup.term: {Building_Materials}Sample of bricks or worked stone collected from this Context.
{Soil}General collection of soil deposit from the Context.
{Wood/Charcoal} Collection of wood or charcoal fragments from the Context.
{C14_Sample}An organic sample recovered for radiocarbon dating.
{Flot_Sample}Flotation sample for recovery of plant remains.
{Phytolith_Sample} Small soil sample for phytolith analysis.
{Thin_Section} Specially collected blocks for soil thin sectioning.
{Animal_Bone} A sample of bone identified as animal.
{Human_Bone} A sample of bone identified as human.
{zOther} Sample not elsewhere described. Include details in Annotation field.

property.name: Sample Volume
property.description: Volume (in litres) of the sample collected.

property.name: Sample Comments
property.description: Additional comments about this sample or its collection.

property.name: Sample Location
property.description: The location of the sample at the time of entry.

property.name: Sample X
property.description: The reading from the x-axis (horizontal) of an arbitrary site grid corresponding to the location of the Sample at the time of excavation.

property.name: Sample Y
property.description: The reading from the y-axis (vertical) of an arbitrary site grid corresponding to the location of the Sample at the time of excavation.

property.name: Sample Z
property.description: The elevation or depth of the Sample at the time of excavation.

property.name: Structural Components
property.description: Primary components of structure or feature eg dry-pressed brick rough-hewn stone.

property.name: Bonding
property.description: Primary bonding material of structure or feature eg mortar.

lookup.term: {Unmortared} No visible bonding material ie unmortared

property.name: Distinguishing Marks
property.description: stinguishing marks on brick or stone.

property.name: Structure Description
property.description: Other description about structural elements eg slate dry-proofing.

property.name: Sketch
property.description: Upload the file of a sketch of the context/artefact etc drawn on another application using the button below

property.name: Photo
property.description: Use this button to take a photo of the context/artefact etc using the camera on the tablet

property.name: Audio
property.description: Use this button to record an audio file of your observations concerning this context/artefact

property.name: Video
property.description: Use this button to record a video using the tablet of this context/artefact etc

property.name: Site Code
property.description: Short code to signify the excavation site and often the year of excavation. Assigned automatically by the module.

property.name: Context ID
property.description: Unique number or code for each Context.

property.name: Special Find ID
property.description: Unique number or code for the Small Find.

property.name: Special Find Class
property.description: Broad Artefact Class for each Artefact (eg Glass Ceramic Building Material).

property.name: Special Find Name
property.description: Brief name or description of the Small Find e.g. Ground Stone Pounder

property.name: Special Find X
property.description: The reading from the x-axis (horizontal) of an arbitrary site grid corresponding to the location of the Small Find at the time of excavation.

property.name: Special Find Y
property.description: The reading from the y-axis (vertical) of an arbitrary site grid corresponding to the location of the Small Find at the time of excavation.

property.name: Special Find Z
property.description: The elevation or depth of the Small Find at the time of excavation.

property.name: Special Find Description
property.description: Description of the Small Find.

property.name: Photo
property.description: Use this button to take a photo of the context/artefact etc using the camera on the tablet

property.name: Audio
property.description: Use this button to record an audio file of your observations concerning this context/artefact

property.name: Video
property.description: Use this button to record a video using the tablet of this context/artefact etc

ArchaeologicalElement.name: Investigator
ArchaeologicalElement.description: A team member not recording the data

property.name: Role
property.description: Role of the associated Investigator.

property.name: Initials
property.description: Associated Investigators Iniitals

property.name: First Name
property.description: Associated Investigators First Name

property.name: Last Name
property.description: Associated Investigators Last Name

ArchaeologicalElement.name: Photograph Log
ArchaeologicalElement.description: A record of images created and stored on another device, eg by a professional site photographer.

property.name: Context ID
property.description: Unique number or code for each Context

property.name: Photograph Reference ID
property.description: Unique number or code allocated by creator of the image. It could be a filename or a reference number

property.name: Scene Type
property.description: The type of scene captured, eg opening or closing view of the Context.

lookup.term: Open Photograph taken on opening the Context.
Close Photograph taken on closing the Context.
Other Scene not elsewhere described. Enter detail into Annotation field.
